entry.title: Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over: DSCO participates in enhanced DUII patrols
entry.summary: Douglas County Sheriff's Office (DSCO) is partnering with the U.S. Department of Transportation’s National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and Oregon Impact to remind all drivers to Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over.

entry.title: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTY, NEARBY AREAS
entry.summary: December 24, 2025 3:50 a.m. A Wind Advisory remains in effect for central Douglas County, eastern Curry County and Josephine County. Southeast winds of 20 to 30 miles per hour with gusts up to 55 miles per hour are expected in some locations. The Advisory area includes the entire Interstate 5 corridor, especially over the...

entry.title: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS
entry.summary: December 24, 2025 3:40 a.m. A High Wind Warning remains in effect through 1:00 p.m. Wednesday for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said southeast winds of 35 to 50 miles per hour with gusts up to 75 miles per hour are expected. 1 to 4...

entry.title: Q&A: Rep. Virgle Osborne
entry.summary: This interview has been edited for brevity and style. For the full interview go to kqennewsradio.com. Virgle Osborne is State Representative for Oregon’s House District 2. He first took office in November 2022.

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY GOVERNMENT OFFICES CLOSED ON CHRISTMAS/NEW YEARS EVE
entry.summary: December 24, 2025 3:30 a.m. Douglas County government offices will be closed on Christmas Day and New Year’s Day. A county release said that includes offices at the courthouse, Justice Building, Courthouse Annex in Reedsport, transfer stations, fairgrounds, and all external government offices. As always, even when county government offices are closed, many officials and...

entry.summary: December 24, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Oregon State Police Fish and Wildlife Division is investigating a report of a bull elk that was shot and left to waste on November 22nd, the opening day of the Tioga Second Season. An OSP release said the bull elk was left in the area of the 8400 line...

entry.title: COSA NAMES JON MARTZ 2026 OREGON HIGH SCHOOL PRINCIPAL OF THE YEAR
entry.summary: December 24, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Oregon Association of Secondary School Administrators, a subset of Coalition of Oregon School Administrators, has named Sutherlin High School Principal Jon Martz, as the 2026 Oregon High School Principal of the year. The announcement was made last week by COSA Executive Director Dr. Krista Parent. A COSA release said...

entry.title: SNAP RECIPIENTS IN 19 OREGON COUNTIES HAVE TIME TO REPLACE FOOD
entry.summary: December 24, 2025 2:50 a.m. Residents of Douglas and 18 other Oregon counties who lost food bought with Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits because of recent storms and power outages now have more time to ask for replacement benefits. A release said the Oregon Department of Human Services has extended the deadline to 30 days...

entry.title: Roseburg Disposal offers free Christmas tree recycling at multiple sites until January 12
entry.summary: Roseburg Disposal Co. will offer free Christmas tree recycling from December 29 through January 12, with drop off locations available throughout Roseburg and surrounding areas.

entry.title: TRUE WEALTH 12.23.25
entry.summary: Presented by Littlejohn Financial, David Littlejohn and Matt Dickson have their pre-Christmas program.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Jumps From Moving Car to Evade Police, Arrested
entry.summary: Roseburg police arrested a man wanted in a violent robbery after he jumped from a moving car in an attempt to escape officers. A police K-9 helped track him down. He now faces multiple felony charges in Douglas County.

entry.title: Regional Engineering Powerhouse Formed via Triple-Merger of Rogue Valley Firms
entry.summary: MEDFORD, OR – December 23, 2025 – In a move set to redefine the Southern Oregon development landscape, three of the Rogue Valley’s most prominent professional services firms have finalized a major merger. CSA Planning, CEC Engineering, and Marquez and Associates have officially joined forces with AKS Engineering and Forestry LLC, creating a regional titan… The post Regional Engineering Powerhouse Formed via Triple-Merger of Rogue Valley Firms appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Fish & Wildlife Investigating Bull Elk Shot and Left to Waste in Douglas County
entry.summary: Oregon State Police Fish and Wildlife Division is investigating a bull elk shot and left to waste on the opening day of Tioga Second Season near Hubbard Creek in Douglas County. Anyone with information is urged to contact the TIP line.

entry.title: Puck’s Donuts Owners Announce Retirement; 50-Year Legacy to Continue with Next Generation
entry.summary: ASHLAND/PHOENIX, OR — Kimo and Mim, the longtime owners of the iconic Puck’s Donuts, have officially announced their retirement effective January 1, 2026. After nearly three decades of ownership, the couple will pass the torch to their daughter, Vilay, and her partner, Nicholas, ensuring the family-run business remains a staple of the Southern Oregon community.… The post Puck’s Donuts Owners Announce Retirement; 50-Year Legacy to Continue with Next Generation appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: WIND AND WINTER STORMS EXPECTED TO IMPACT HOLIDAY TRAVEL
entry.summary: December 23, 2025 3:00 p.m. Staff with the Oregon Department of Transportation is urging travelers to plan carefully around the timing of a strong windstorm expected to impact Oregon on Christmas Eve, a peak holiday travel period. Current forecasts call for strong winds from mid-morning through mid-day on Wednesday, when many people may be traveling...

entry.title: The Masterpiece Strategy: How The Websters Transformed Boutique Retail into a Global Destination
entry.summary: ASHLAND, OR — In the shifting landscape of American retail, the “Experience Economy” has moved from a buzzword to a survival strategy. While many brick-and-mortar shops struggle against digital disruption, The Websters, a premier fiber arts destination in Ashland, is rewriting the script. Their model for the March 2026 Retreat provides a masterclass in how… The post The Masterpiece Strategy: How The Websters Transformed Boutique Retail into a Global Destination appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Proposed Order Would Require New Fish Passage at Winchester Dam by 2028
entry.summary: A proposed order would require the Winchester Water Control District to build new fish passage at Winchester Dam by 2028. The ruling follows a contested case over whether 2023 dam repairs triggered modern fish passage requirements under Oregon law.

entry.summary: An encore program today featuring a recent interview with new new Adapt Integrated Health Care CEO Steve Baron.

entry.title: Watermain breaks on West Harvard Avenue on Saturday night
entry.summary: A watermain break at the intersection of West Harvard Avenue and West Umpqua Street on Saturday night caused a mess and the city of Roseburg is working to fix the situation.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 12.23.25
entry.summary: Captain Edith-Dye Mabie of the Salvation Army Roseburg Corps talks about the needs they are seeing this holiday season and how the community can help out before Christmas Day.

entry.title: Birders flock to the outdoors for 126th annual Audubon Christmas Bird Count
entry.summary: It's a wet, freezing cold morning at Stewart Park. A group makes their way through grassy fields, boots squelching through mud and icy-numb fingers clutching hand warmers.

entry.title: Absolute Motosport to Close Roseburg and Grants Pass Locations After December 31
entry.summary: Absolute Motosport has announced it will close its Roseburg and Grants Pass locations after December 31. A liquidation sale is underway with unmarked pricing and deep discounts on all in-stock inventory. The Roseburg store is open Monday through Wednesday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

entry.title: Cash Stolen After ATM Damaged at Rogue Credit Union in Roseburg
entry.summary: Roseburg Police are investigating an early-morning ATM theft at Rogue Credit Union on NW Garden Valley Blvd. Officers found a damaged ATM and a stolen pickup left running at the scene. Two suspects fled in a white SUV. The investigation is ongoing.

entry.title: LOCAL BUSINESS CLOSURE – COLORCRAFT PAINT
entry.summary: Colorcraft Paint, located next to the former Waldron’s Outdoor Sports on Garden Valley Blvd, has closed after serving the Roseburg community for 70 years. The longtime local business thanked the community as it marked the end of an era.

entry.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE TO PARTICIPATE IN ENHANCED DUII PATROLS THIS HOLIDAY SEASON
entry.summary: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office will conduct enhanced DUII patrols from December 10 through January 1 as part of the Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over campaign, focusing on removing impaired drivers from local roadways during the holiday season.

entry.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI’S WILD LIGHTS BRINGS HOLIDAY MAGIC TO WINSTON
entry.summary: Wildlife Safari’s Wild Lights brings holiday magic to Winston with illuminated paths, animal encounters, hot cocoa, Santa visits, and the popular Candy Cane Caboose. With one weekend left, families still have time to enjoy this seasonal tradition.

entry.title: Roseburg Schools calls on community for facilities committee input
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools is inviting community members to join a new Community Facilities Advisory Committee. This group will help assess the condition of aging school buildings and explore long-term facility needs.

entry.title: RFP Dillard plywood layoffs settlements come to a close
entry.summary: On Sept. 25, Roseburg Forest Products (RFP) announced it had discontinued operations at its hardwood plywood facility in Dillard, leading to layoffs for more than 100 employees.

entry.title: ODOT lays out upcoming projects to continue into new year
entry.summary: As the year comes to a close, the Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) is looking forward to a year of new and ongoing projects intended to make roads safer for motorists and pedestrians alike.

entry.title: Sutherlin Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade returns for 33rd year
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — As Cody Salberg handed out hot drinks and snacks to a crowd of smiling faces, it occurred to her that this kind of happiness and togetherness is what Sutherlin is all about.

entry.title: Oregon anglers get a bigger lingcod limit in 2026 per ODFW Commission
entry.summary: Coastal anglers will be able to keep more lingcod in 2026, while Oregon’s general marine bag limit for rockfish and other nearshore species will remain at four fish per day.

entry.title: WILD SPRING CHINOOK HARVEST PROHIBITED ON MAINSTEM UMPQUA
entry.summary: December 22, 2025 3:05 a.m. On Friday, the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife announced a temporary rule prohibiting wild spring Chinook salmon harvest on the mainstem Umpqua River and keeping the North Umpqua bag limit the same as 2025. An ODFW release said from February 1st through June 30th: *Mainstem Umpqua River: only hatchery...

entry.title: MERKLEY: NOW IS THE TIME FOR COMMONSENSE CANNABIS REFORMS

entry.title: Sutherlin Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade Raises $7,000, Honors 2025 Winners
entry.summary: Sutherlin’s Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade featured 79 vehicles, raised $7,000 in sponsorships, and paid out all prize money across multiple categories while reflecting on nearly two decades of community tradition.
